message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the composition of living organisms. Living organisms are made up of life material, also known as organic material, which includes elements such as carbon, hydrogen, nitrogen, oxygen, and other trace elements. Option (A) is incorrect because cola is a beverage and not a component of living organisms. Option (C) is incorrect because while soil can support the growth of organisms, it is not a component of their structure. Option (D) is incorrect because sap is a fluid found in plants and trees, but not a component of all living organisms.

This question requires knowledge about the characteristics of living organisms. Living organisms are made up of life material, such as cells, tissues, and organs. Option (A) is incorrect because cola is a beverage and not a component of living organisms. Option (C) is incorrect because soil is an external environment that organisms interact with, but it is not part of their composition. Option (D) is incorrect because sap is a fluid found in plants and is not a universal component of all organisms.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the definition and composition of organisms. Option (C) is incorrect because soil is not a component of organisms, although it may be a habitat for certain organisms. Option (D) is incorrect because sap is a fluid found in plants and trees, not a component of organisms.
